General.Name: CAP S.A
General.Description: CAP S.A. engages in iron ore mining, steel production, steel processing, and infrastructure businesses in Chile and internationally. The company explores, evaluates, and develops mineral ores; and produces iron ore and pellets in the Pacific coast. It also produces and sells corrosion-resistant rebars, grinding rods, reinforcing bars, helical bars, CAP-SOL bars, wire rods, limestone, and quicklime. In addition, the company offers pipes and conduit; corrugated steel products; roofs and claddings for sheds, and industrial and commercial warehouses; highway guard rails; photovoltaic structures; insulated panels, open profiles, laminated profiles, metalcon building systems, collaborative plates, steel plates, tubest, and tubular profiles. Further, it engages in desalinated water production business; constructs power transmission lines and substations; port docking services for ships; imports, exports and cabotage cargo transfers; yard services; storage, reception, and dispatch of cargo; and equipment rentals, as well as electricity transmission services. The company was formerly known as Compañía de Acero del Pacífico S.A. de Inversiones and changed its name to CAP S.A. in May 1991. CAP S.A. was incorporated in 1946 and is based in Las Condes, Chile.
General.Address: No. 220 Gertrudis Echenique, Las Condes, Chile
